entry.title: Langton's Ant
entry.content:
Description

Langtonâ€™s Ant is a 4-state two-dimensional Turing machine invented in the 1980s. The ant starts out on a grid containing black and white cells, and then proceeds according to the following set of rules:

  1. If the ant is on a black square, it turns right 90 degrees and moves forward one unit.
  2. If the ant is on a white square, it turns left 90 degrees and moves forward one unit.
  3. When the ant leaves a square, it inverts the color.
